item.title: MAKING SOFTWARE
item.description: A reference manual for people who design and build software.

item.title: Stop Using MVVM - Nick's .NET Travels
item.description: The Model-View-ViewModel (MVVM) pattern has long been a cornerstone in building maintainable and testable UIs across frameworks like WPF, Xamarin, Uno Platform, and others. It provides a clean separation of concerns and enables powerful data binding. But despite its popularity and maturity, MVVM often introduces unnecessary complexity and friction—particularly when it comes to state management ... Read more

item.title: Reading Neuromancer for the very first time in 2025
item.description: So many sci-fi movies, anime, and video games owe a massive debt of gratitude to William Gibson's seminal 1984 novel.

item.title: Artificial intelligence is a commodity, but understanding is a superpower
item.description: Developers have nothing to fear from generative AI, but self-cultivation is key.

item.title: Let me pay for Firefox!
item.description: Hi Mozilla community, I’m a long time Mozilla supporter, I’ve published free (as in freedom) and open-source software, and I desperately want Mozilla to charge for Firefox. If that sounds like a contradiction, please keep reading. I first became involved with the Mozilla community around 2006. I was active in the Spread Firefox project, where I ran a contest that encouraged others to promote Firefox in the most creative ways they could imagine. In hindsight, I guess it could have been called a...
